boat.name: Clearwater
boat.construction_details: GRP hull with sheathed plywood deck and coachroof. Encapsulated lead keel to enable 1 ft reduced draft compared with standard Tamarisk 29 construction which uses encapulated steel punchings as ballast. Supplementary internal ballast consisting of 250 kg in lead ingots added for trimming purposes.
boat.short_description:
'Clearwater' is a Tamarisk 29, the lines of which were taken directly from one of the fastest and most sea-kindly of the Falmouth Working Boats.

The hull was built by Cygnus Marine in Penryn and fitted out by North Cornwall Marine in St.Columb.

for_sales.sales_text:
A much admired traditional west-country gaff cutter (frequently said to be 'the prettiest boat in the harbour'), "Clearwater" is now for sale following an intensive upgrade, renewal and refurbishment programme carried out over the last few years. Built in 1980 by Cygnus Marine (Penryn) and fitted out by North Cornwall Marine (St.Columb), with only two owners from new, "Clearwater" has been lovingly maintained throughout her life and has been in the current ownership (of a now retired Master Mariner) for 22 years.

She is now fitted out to an exceptionally high standard for short-handed and long-distance cruising with a view to maximising efficiency and ease of ownership, handling and comfort with standing headroom accommodation. She is a fast passage maker with a surprisingly easy driven hull form, frequently reaching her hull speed of nearly 7 knots with her powerful gaff cutter rig. She points well upwind, performing as well as many Bermudan rigged boats, and is particularly fast off the wind.

Currently ashore at Mylor.

Hull

Dark green (Donegal Green) topsides with sand coloured deck and Ivory coachroof. Approx 8.5 tonnes displacement. Registered tonnage 6.14 tons (Part 1 of UK Register of Shipping). Long keel with encapsulated lead ballast and additional internal lead trimming ballast enabling her large sail plan to be carried on a relatively shoal draft of 1.30 mtrs (4ft 3in). Coppercoated (2013) to minimise annual maintenance. 3 x Duratank flexible water tanks (tailored by Griffon Hoverworks) total capacity 430 ltrs (2015). 90 ltrs stainless diesel tank. Stainless steel rudder fittings, pushpit, stern boarding ladder (with swimming extensions) and guardrail stanchions.

Accommodation

5 berths arranged as follows. Forward cabin: 2 x single berths. Saloon: 1 x pilot berth; 1 x double berth. The Saloon can be configured to provide an enormous double berth by linking the pilot and double berths together. Dry powder extinguishers and smoke detectors in saloon and forward cabin. Traditional oil lamps are available for reinstatement in Saloon (2) and forward cabin (1). Traditional oil lamps are available for reinstatement in Saloon (2) and forward cabin (1).

Sails and Rig

New sails (2015) by gaff rig specialists SKB Penryn consisting of tan coloured battened main, jib, staysail and cream/green topsail. Cruising chute with snuffer. Storm jib. Spare suit of tan coloured sails. Harken roller furling on jib and staysail. 2 x Lewmar 15 self-tailing jib sheet winches (2015). 2 x Gibb 7 self-tailing staysail sheet winches. 1 x Gibb 7 reefing winch on boom. Douglas Fir mast and spars. Lifting bowsprit. Mast fitted with glass/epoxy anti-chafe protection sleeve in way of gaff saddle (covering all reefing points). Stainless steel chainplates, boom gooseneck, gaff saddle and bowsprit fittings. Spinlock clutches for furling lines (2015) and running backstays. Barton mainsheet blocks (2016).

Machinery and Electrical

Bukh 20ME direct cooled diesel engine (major overhaul 2013). Teleflex engine controls (2015). 16' Featherstream feathering propeller (2013). High output engine driven alternator. Sterling smart charge controller. HD spilt charge diode. Rutland/Marlec 913 wind generator (refurbished 2016) with RWS200 charge regulator. 3 x 80 AH domestic (leisure) batteries. 1 x 80 AH HD engine battery. Low energy lighting throughout (including navigation lights). Fixed dry powder engineroom extinguisher.

Navigation and Instruments

Raymarine "Smart Pilot" HD Tillerpilot. Garmin GPS 152. NASA Clipper GPS repeater. Tacktick Hull (depth, speed, heading) and Wind (masthead) instruments. Standard Horizon GX2100 DSC VHF with integral AIS receiver display. ICS Nav4 Plus Navtex with 518/490 converter unit. Plastimo Contest compass. Firdell Blipper radar reflector. Plastimo Clock and Barometer.

Ground Tackle

15 kg Rocna Vulcan galvanised anchor (2015). 60 mtr x 10 mm galvanised calibrated short link chain (2014) and 50 mtr warp. Lofrans Kobra 1000W windlass with remote wireless control (2014). 25 lb CQR kedge with chain and warp. Telescopic Yacht Leg & Cradle aluminium beaching legs (2016). Bespoke stainless steel stemhead fitting incorporating anchor stowage, chain rollers, mooring fairleads and staysail furler eyeplate (2015).

Domestic

Wallas 2400T kerosene hot air cabin heater (3 outlets) (2014). Waeco fridge. Whale shower with hot/cold mixer (manual-fill hot water tank in heads). Pressurised water system with backup manual footpump in galley. Spinflo Nelson LPG cooker (2-burner, grill and oven). Smev satin stainless steel sink and drainer inset in Corian worktop (2014). Blakes Lavac toilet (2014). Beige easy-clean vinyl upholstery and Flotex carpet. Dorade vents (2016). Sprayhood, dodgers, sailcover, cockpit cushions and tent (sand coloured). Lagun cockpit table. Cockpit sole teak gratings. Omnimax TV antenna and signal booster. Sony stereo radio and CD player.

Liferaft, Horseshoe Lifebuoy, Flares and Dinghy

Seago Offshore 4-person canister liferaft (certified until 2019) mounted on pushpit frame. Horseshoe lifebuoy. Pains-Wessex Coastal flarepack (2016). Honwave 250AE inflatable dinghy with aluminium deck.
